div1.p: John Kissinger's back problems are limiting his activity.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A.Kelly, May 19, 1907
div1.p:
yours of the 16
to hand and will reply at once to
Say to you that the money you menti-
oned- in your letter was not
there- now understand Its- this way
I write you only for the Purpose
of letting you know that we had
not received It. that perhaps the
letter had been Tanperd with and
thought by letting you know you
might stop payment to someone
else we certainly do not ask you to
pay for Photos- For we appreciate your
kindness to Mr Kissinger and the Instrest
you have shown that we certainly can do
our Post.

What letter we are able to do without
2
pay Mr Kissinger is feeling quite
despondent at times as his back
hurts him quite a good deal: hoping
this is all right and will meet
with a friendly approval we beg to
remain your Friends
